results.title: The Parents
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Let’s Talk about It”.
In this final film of the Let’s Talk About It series, the parents of the children in the films are interviewed after nine months.

results.title: Birth day
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Let’s Talk about It”.
Part two of a three part series of three films following through the educational experiences of an upper primary school class. Through interviews with families and with pregnant women, and through visits to hospitals and baby health centres, the children learn about pregnancy, childbirth and childcare.

results.title: Male and female
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Let’s Talk about It”.
Part one of a three part series which follows through the educational experiences of an upper primary school class as they learn about human reproduction and sexuality. In this part the children explore their concepts of ‘maleness’ and ‘femaleness’ with their teachers, learning about anatomical differences, the process of fertilisation and conception. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Let's Talk about It
results.brief_description: The first three programs in this series follow the experiences of an upper primary school class as they learn about human reproduction and sexuality. The final two programs discuss the experience with the teachers and parents.

results.title: The Teachers
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Let’s Talk about It”.
Provides comments from the two teachers involved in the sex education program “Let’s Talk About It”. Includes clips from the series and discussions of the problems and rewards of teaching sex education.

results.title: Black belt Jones
results.creator_credit: Robert Clouse, Paul Heller, Fred Weintraub and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Pop Boyd (Scatman Crothers) owns a thriving karate school near downtown Los Angeles. Unfortunately it sits on a piece of land upon which the local mob wants to build its own ‘civic centre’. When the gangsters’ muscling of Pop leads to tragedy, Black Belt Jones (Jim Kelly) steps forward to exact his own brand of lightning-charged revenge. Filmmaker Robert Crouse, who showcased Bruce Lee in ‘Enter the dragon’ and Jackie Chan in ‘The big brawl’, serves up masterful action sequences in which every move is choreographed like a ballet. Cast also includes Gloria Hendry, Eric Laneuville, Alan Weeks, Andre Philippe and Vincent Barbi. See also ‘Game of death’ (1978), ‘Enter the dragon’ (1973), ‘The big brawl’ (1980).

results.title: Birds of the seashore
results.creator_credit: Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A close-up view of the water birds of Canada’s east coast - their habits, breeding grounds, peculiarities and distinguishing marks. Included are herring gulls, gannets, eider ducks, great blue herons, black guillemots, razor-billed auks and cormorants. Throughout the film many bird calls are heard.

results.title: Birds of Canada. No. 6
results.creator_credit: Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The pileated woodpecker, the yellow-bellied sapsucker and the common loon are objects of study in this film. The distinguishing features of the woodpecker and sapsucker are pointed out, while the loon, a water bird, comes in for special mention.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Birdman of paradise; William T. Cooper: portrait painter to the birds
results.creator_credit: Paul Reddish, Robert Campbell, BBC, National Geographic Society and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: John Young is an expert on Australia’s Birds of Paradise. These rare birds are difficult to track and we follow John’s endeavours to record the mating rituals and displays of these birds. Bird artist William Cooper’s illustrations are considered the finest in this genre of painting. Sir David Attenborough narrates this program on a truly great artist.
results.title_for_label: Birdman of paradise; William T. Cooper: portrait painter to the birds

results.title: Birdman of Alcatraz
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Guy Trosper, Stuart Millar and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Robert Stroud was sentenced to serve 40 years in solitary confinement in Alcatraz. Nevertheless, he became one of the foremost authorities on birds and their diseases. His fascination and love for birds began when he nursed a sick and injured sparrow back to health. Encouraged in prison by a guard, Stroud developed his interest in birds which was strangely at odds with the harshness of the prison environment. Burt Lancaster gives an excellent performance as Stroud, Karl Malden plays the Warden, Telly Savalas is Stroud’s prison mate, Neville Brand is the prison guard and Thelma Ritter is outstanding as Stroud’s domineering mother.
